label.text: Crab Traps
Crabs are crustaceans that are a popular food source. They are caught in wire traps that lie on the ocean floor.
A rope attaches each trap to a buoy that floats on the surface of the water so that the trap can be collected.
Crab traps can be lost when boats break the ropes that attach the traps to the buoys. Lost traps remain on the ocean floor and can continue to trap small sea animals.
Researchers have designed an escape panel for crab traps, which is made from a biodegradable material.
After 10 months in the water, the escape panel completely dissolves. This creates a wide opening that allows small sea animals to enter and exit the traps.
rope
escape panel
mussels
Crabs and small sea animals get trapped
Escape panel starts to dissolve
Crabs and small sea animals can enter and exit the trap
Are these features an advantage to the design of the escape panel for a crab trap?
Select ‘Yes’ or ‘No’ for each feature.
The escape panel does not produce toxic materials when it dissolves.
The escape panel adds to the cost of the crab traps.
The escape panel does not interfere with the number of crabs that fishers can collect.
The escape panel dissolves within a year of the trap being lost in the ocean.
The crab traps that are currently used have a metal opening.
The crab fishing industry wants to know if the crab traps with escape panels work as well as the current crab traps.
Which one of the following experimental methods would best compare the function of the two types of crab traps?
Place both types of crab traps next to each other in areas where crabs have been caught before.
Monitor how many crabs are caught in each trap.
Place crab traps with escape panels in a number of locations in the ocean.
Monitor how many crabs are caught in the traps at each location.
Replace the current crab traps with the new crab traps.
Place the current crab traps in one study area and the new crab traps in a different study area.
Crab traps can cause many problems.
Which of the following problems could be solved by using crab traps with escape panels?
Select ‘Yes’ or ‘No’ for each statement.
The traps catch other types of small sea animals, not just crabs.
Some small sea animals attach to the outside of the traps to grow.
Some crabs and small sea animals die in lost traps.
Lost traps continue to trap sea animals until the wire rusts away.
